events.message: Customer reported a car collision on the highway resulting in damage to the front bumper and hood of the vehicle.
Claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident as damage involves vehicle collision with another car.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to assist the customer throughout the claims process for their auto accident.
The insurance company acknowledged the report of the auto accident and confirmed receipt of the initial claim documents.
Request sent to customer for additional documentation including photos of the damaged vehicle and police accident report.
Customer submitted all requested documents, including high-resolution images of the damaged auto and the official police report.
Claims investigation initiated to verify the circumstances and assess the extent of the damage to the vehicle.
Investigation concluded confirming that the collision was caused by rear-end impact from another vehicle fault.
A settlement amount was proposed based on repair estimates and the insurance policy coverage terms for the accident.
Customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed appreciation for the quick resolution process.
The claim was officially approved by the insurance company, confirming coverage for the vehicle repairs.
Payment for the approved settlement amount was issued and transferred to the customer's bank account successfully.
The claim was closed after payment issuance and repair completion confirmation from the customer.
All documentation and records related to the auto accident claim have been archived for future reference.
